meanings.definition: To wind (something) onto a spool again.
meanings.sent1: She respooled the thread after it got tangled.
meanings.sent2: He respooled the fishing line to prepare for his next fishing trip.
meanings.sent3: The cat respooled the yarn, thinking it was a fun game.
meanings.sent4: The memories respooled in her mind as she watched the old film.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic respooled the cable with precision and care.

meanings.definition: To reload (a film or tape) onto a spool.
meanings.sent1: After the movie ended, he respooled the film for the next showing.
meanings.sent2: She respooled the cassette tape to listen to her favorite song again.
meanings.sent3: The detective respooled the surveillance footage to catch the culprit.
meanings.sent4: The musician respooled the tape to fix a recording mistake.
meanings.sent5: The librarian respooled the old film for the movie night event.

meanings.definition: To reorganize or rearrange (something) in a new way.
meanings.sent1: She respooled her schedule to fit in the new dance class.
meanings.sent2: He respooled the layout of the room for better flow.
meanings.sent3: The kids respooled their toys into neat piles after playing.
meanings.sent4: The artist respooled the colors on the palette for a fresh painting.
meanings.sent5: The team respooled their strategy to adapt to the opponent's tactics.
